Summary: Share data down the component tree with Parameters. Create an IParameter<T> in a parent and access it from descendants to read/update a shared value; changes invalidate dependents to re-render.
Remarks: Component Parameters automatically flow from a parent to all descendants. Declare a parameter with [Param] IParameter<T> in an ancestor; any child can read/write via .Value and .Set(update). When a parameter changes, MauiReactor invalidates referencing components (starting from the defining parent) so they re-render accordingly. Use IParameter<T>.Set(action, invalidateComponent: false) to avoid full re-render and only update bound properties when appropriate. Parameters can be accessed from any ancestor, not just the direct parent.
